cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.current_location: about 90 mi (145 km) south of Cozumel, Mexico

motion.direction: Stationary (expected to resume northward later today)

cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to move north across the eastern Gulf of Mexico, make landfall along the Florida Panhandle, then accelerate northeast across the southeastern U.S. and off the New England coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle near the Apalachicola/Big Bend area

weather_observation.watch_coast: No U.S. watches in effect as of this advisory
weather_observation.warning_coast: No U.S. warnings in effect as of this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Panhandle to the entire U.S. East Coast, including New England during days 4-5
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely (current guidance suggests 1-3 inches for eastern MA)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely (track keeps strongest surge confined to Gulf Coast)
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤6%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; brief gusts possible late Thursday night into Friday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for Boston based on present forecast track and intensity
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of moderate to heavy rain possible late Thursday into Friday as the remnant cyclone passes; localized ponding possible on terminal surfaces
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief reduced visibilities and elevated seas in Boston approaches (4–7 ft) could disrupt pilotage and cargo handling
